<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Pickpocket](/Feats.aspx?ID=818) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 264 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17)

</column>

---

You can Steal or Palm an Object that’s closely guarded, such as in a pocket, without taking the –5 penalty. You can’t steal objects that would be extremely noticeable or time consuming to remove (like worn shoes or armor or actively wielded objects). If you’re a master in Thievery, you can attempt to Steal from a creature in combat or otherwise on guard. When doing so, Stealing requires 2 manipulate actions instead of 1, and you take a –5 penalty.

<title level="2">Pickpocket leads to...</title>
[Larcenous Hand](/Feats.aspx?ID=3384), [Legendary Thief](/Feats.aspx?ID=809), [Plant Evidence](/Feats.aspx?ID=1781)
name: Pickpocket
